page.title: 01GENERAL - The UZMASTON Area
page.content: This area lies South East of HAVERFORDWEST and includes parts of the communities of {Uzmaston, Boulston {and Slebech, Haroldston St.Issells.}It is gently undulating countryside, mainly grassland, rising to a {height {of 172 ft.}and drained by 2 miles of Western Cleddau, also by Millin Brook and other Cleddau tributaries. Ther are tidal marshes and alluvium deposits on the Haroldston side of the Cleddau.{Underlying rocks} are Silurian mudstones and sandstone North of Uzmaston and Carboniferous Limestone, Millstone grit and Coal measures South of the village, which is situated on glacial sands and gravels (1 mile across) with boulder clay Eastwards towards Millin Brook. Limestone was once quarried near the River, South of Hanton.
